net.proteusframework.ui.miwt

Class HTMLRenderContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.HTMLRenderContext
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Appendable, Cloneable

    public final class HTMLRenderContext
extends Object
implements Cloneable, Appendable
    The context used when rendering HTML. Each instance is intended for one time use.
    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

      • printComment

        public void printComment(String s)
        Output a comment to the HTML page. The comment tags are managed by this object so that the user of the object does not need to be concerned with comment tags.
        Parameters:
        s - The comment.

      • printComponentProperties

        public void printComponentProperties(Component com,
                            @Nullable
                            RendererEditorState<?> state,
                            String... wrappingElements)
        Output component properties, such as drag and drop information. This must be done in the component rendering so that the properties are updated with AJAX properly.
        Parameters:
        com - the component.
        state - the render/editor state.
        wrappingElements - elements to wrap the data, if any, may be null. Ex: "tr", "td"

      • printComponentPropertiesAsAttributes

        public void printComponentPropertiesAsAttributes(Component com)
        Output component properties, such as drag and drop information, as data-* attributes. This must be done in the component rendering so that the properties are updated with AJAX properly.
        Parameters:
        com - the component. May be null.

        public void printDataAttribute(CharSequence name,
                      CharSequence value)
        Output configuration data using a data attribute. The value will be escaped by this method.
        Parameters:
        name - the name to identify the data. Don't include "data-".
        value - the value.

      • printDisplayClass

        public void printDisplayClass(Component com)
        Output the component's display class as a "class" attribute if it is non-null. A space will be output before the attribute and no space afterwards.
        Parameters:
        com - The component, must not be null.

      • printDisplayClass

        public void printDisplayClass(Component com,
                     String suffix)
        Output the component's display class as a "class" attribute if it is non-null. A space will be output before the attribute and no space afterwards.
        Parameters:
        com - The component, must not be null.
        suffix - A suffix to append.

      • printDisplayClass

        public void printDisplayClass(String displayClass)
        Output the "class" attribute with the given value if it is non-null. A space will be output before the attribute and no space afterwards.
        Parameters:
        displayClass - The display class, may be null.

      • printDisplayClass

        public void printDisplayClass(String displayClass,
                     String suffix)
        Output the "class" attribute with the given value if it is non-null. A space will be output before the attribute and no space afterwards. If the displayClass argument is null and the suffix argument is not null then only the suffix will be output.
        Parameters:
        displayClass - The display class, may be null.
        suffix - A suffix to append.

      • printDisplayClasses

        public void printDisplayClasses(Component com,
                       Column column,
                       Class<?> dataType,
                       boolean firstColumn,
                       boolean lastColumn)
        Print display classes for a table column.
        Parameters:
        com - the component.
        column - the column object.
        dataType - the column data type.
        firstColumn - true if this is the first column.
        lastColumn - true if this is the last column.

      • printDisplayClasses

        public void printDisplayClasses(Component com,
                       @Nullable
                       String extraClasses)
        Output the component's display class as a "class" attribute if it is non-null. A space will be output before the attribute and no space afterwards. The extraClasses will be added after the component class separated by white space. If the component class is null the extraClasses will be output.
        Parameters:
        com - The component, must not be null.
        extraClasses - Extra classes to add.

      • printDisplayClasses

        public void printDisplayClasses(Component com,
                       @Nullable
                       String suffix,
                       @Nullable
                       String extraClasses)
        Output the component's display class as a "class" attribute if it is non-null. A space will be output before the attribute and no space afterwards. The extraClasses will be added after the component class separated by white space.
        Parameters:
        com - The component, must not be null.
        suffix - A suffix to append.
        extraClasses - Extra classes to add.

      • printDnDDefinitionsAsMetaProp

        public void printDnDDefinitionsAsMetaProp(Map<String,DragSource> sources,
                                 Map<String,DropTarget> targets,
                                 boolean scope)
        Print multiple DnD sources and targets as meta properties.
        Parameters:
        sources - the sources. a Mapping of ID and DragSource.
        targets - the targets. A mapping of ID and DropTarget.
        scope - flag to output itemscope and itemtype attributes.

      • printDragSourceAsAttribute

        public void printDragSourceAsAttribute(@Nullable
                              DragSource dragSource)
        Print a drag source as an attribute. Printing will only occur if the drag source is not null and has at least one transfer content type.
        Parameters:
        dragSource - the drag source.

      • printDragSourceAsMetaProp

        public void printDragSourceAsMetaProp(@Nullable
                             DragSource dragSource,
                             String id,
                             boolean scope)
        Print a drag source as a meta property. Printing will only occur if the drag source is not null and has at least one transfer content type.
        Parameters:
        dragSource - the drag source.
        id - the document ID of the drag source.
        scope - flag to output itemscope and itemtype attributes.

      • printDragSourcesAsMetaProp

        public void printDragSourcesAsMetaProp(Map<String,DragSource> sources,
                              boolean scope)
        Register multiple drag sources. Registration will only occur if the drag source is not null and has at least one transfer content type.
        Parameters:
        sources - the sources. A mapping of ID and DragSource.
        scope - flag to output itemscope and itemtype attributes.

      • printDropTargetAsAttribute

        public void printDropTargetAsAttribute(@Nullable
                              DropTarget dropTarget)
        Print a drop target as an attribute. Printing will only occur if the drop target is not null and has at least one accept content type.
        Parameters:
        dropTarget - the drop target.

      • printDropTargetAsMetaProp

        public void printDropTargetAsMetaProp(@Nullable
                             DropTarget dropTarget,
                             String id,
                             boolean scope)
        Print a drop target as a meta property. Printing will only occur if the drop target is not null and has at least one accept content type.
        Parameters:
        dropTarget - the drop target.
        id - the document ID of the drop target.
        scope - flag to output itemscope and itemtype attributes.

      • printDropTargetsAsMetaProp

        public void printDropTargetsAsMetaProp(Map<String,DropTarget> targets,
                              boolean scope)
        Print multiple drag sources as meta properties. Printing will only occur if the drag source is not null and has at least one transfer content type.
        Parameters:
        targets - the targets. A mapping of ID and DropTarget.
        scope - flag to output itemscope and itemtype attributes.

      • printElementId

        public boolean printElementId(String id,
                     String tagName)
        Output attributes appropriate for specifying an element ID. Some tags require the "id" attribute and some use the "name" attribute. This implementation outputs both. There will be one space before the attribute(s) and none after. If the ID has already been output then nothing will be output.
        Parameters:
        id - The element ID.
        tagName - The tag name for the attribute(s).
        Returns:
        true if the ID was output or false if nothing was output because the ID has already been output.

      • printEndNoBlockTag

        public void printEndNoBlockTag()
        Print the deliminator for tag that does not contain a block of content. For example ">" or " />".

      • printHiddenValue

        public void printHiddenValue(String name,
                    String value,
                    boolean needDocumentId)
        Adds a hidden form element using the given name and value. The form name is registered by this method. The name and value are escaped as necessary.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the element.
        value - The value.
        needDocumentId - indicate if this element needs to be referenced in the document, a value of true will output an ID attribute equal to the name argument. If unsure, pass true.

      • printHtmlAttribute

        public void printHtmlAttribute(@Nullable
                      CharSequence name,
                      @Nullable
                      CharSequence value)
        Output the string to the HTML page escaped for HTML attribute data. A space is output prior to the attribute.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the attribute.
        value - the attribute value.

      • printHtmlData

        public void printHtmlData(CharSequence s)
        Output the string to the HTML page escaped for HTML data.
        Parameters:
        s - The String to output.

      • printHtmlDataWithBreak

        public void printHtmlDataWithBreak(CharSequence s)
        Output the string to the HTML page escaped for HTML data replacing newlines with break tags. This cannot be used for attribute values.
        Parameters:
        s - The String to output.

      • printHtmlDataWithBreakTags

        public void printHtmlDataWithBreakTags(CharSequence s)
        Output the string to the HTML page escaped for HTML data. Newlines are replaced by break tags.
        Parameters:
        s - The String to output.

      • printHtmlTextAreaData

        public void printHtmlTextAreaData(String s)
        Output the string to the HTML page escaped for HTML data. This also escapes ampersands. Useful for TEXTAREA.
        Parameters:
        s - The String to output.

      • printId

        public boolean printId(Component com)
        Print the "id" attribute for a component. If the component is used as a renderer, the "id" attribute is not output.
        Parameters:
        com - The component.
        Returns:
        true if the ID was output or false if the ID was not output because the ID has already been output OR because the component is inRenderingComponent().

      • printIdAndClass

        public boolean printIdAndClass(Component com)
        Print the "id" attribute for a component. If the component is used as a renderer, the "id" attribute is not output. If the display class is null the "class" attribute is not output.
        Parameters:
        com - The component.
        Returns:
        true if the ID was output or false if the ID was not output because the ID has already been output.

      • printImageDimensions

        public void printImageDimensions(Dimension size)
        Print attributes for an "img" element.
        Parameters:
        size - the size, may be null in which case nothing is done.

      • printLangCodeAttribute

        public void printLangCodeAttribute(@Nullable
                          Component component)
        Print the lang code attribute if necessary. pushLocale(Component) must be called before calling this method.
        Parameters:
        component - the component.

        Output a new line to the HTML page.

      • printlnHtmlData

        public void printlnHtmlData(String s)
        Output the string to the HTML page as HTML data with a line break afterwards.
        Parameters:
        s - The String to output.

      • printMetaProp

        public void printMetaProp(CharSequence prop,
                 CharSequence content,
                 @Nullable
                 CharSequence itemType)
        Print a meta property.
        Parameters:
        prop - the property name.
        content - the content.
        itemType - optional itemType.

      • printNonBreakingSpaceEntityRef

        public void printNonBreakingSpaceEntityRef()
        Output the entity reference for non-breaking space.

      • printRowAttributes

        public void printRowAttributes(Row row,
                      Component com,
                      boolean firstRow,
                      boolean lastRow)
        Output the row's optional attributes.
        Parameters:
        row - The row, must not be null.
        com - The component, may be null.
        firstRow - first row flag.
        lastRow - last row flag.

      • printTooltipAttribute

        public void printTooltipAttribute(Component com)
        Print tool tip attribute. This method is meant to be called in an open tag.
        Parameters:
        com - the component.

      • printTooltipAttributes

        public void printTooltipAttributes(CharSequence toolTipText)
        Print tool tip attributes. If toolTipText is null no action is taken. This method is meant to be called in an open tag.
        Parameters:
        toolTipText - the tool tip text.

      • printTooltipAttributes

        public void printTooltipAttributes(Component com,
                          @Nullable
                          String id,
                          @Nullable
                          String altToolTip)
        Print the tool tip attributes for the given component. If no tool tip is set no action is taken. This method is meant to be called in an open tag.
        Parameters:
        com - the component.
        id - the ID of the element, may be null in which case some tool tip functionality may be unavailable.
        altToolTip - alternate tool tip.

      • printTooltipAttributes

        public void printTooltipAttributes(Component com,
                          @Nullable
                          String id,
                          @Nullable
                          TextSource altToolTip)
        Print the tool tip attributes for the given component. If no tool tip is set no action is taken. This method is meant to be called in an open tag.
        Parameters:
        com - the component.
        id - the ID of the element, may be null in which case some tool tip functionality may be unavailable.
        altToolTip - alternate tool tip.

      • printUrl

        public void printUrl(String url)
        Output the URL. The URL will be processed by the URL encoding of the servlet container before being output. Do not pass a URL that has already been encoded to this method.
        Parameters:
        url - the URL.

      • pushLocale

        public void pushLocale(@Nullable
              Component component)
        Push the locale from the component onto the stack.
        Parameters:
        component - the component.

      • setInListModelComponent

        public void setInListModelComponent(boolean b)
        Set whether this context is rendering in a list cell renderer.
        Parameters:
        b - true if a list cell renderer is being processed.

      • setInTableComponent

        public void setInTableComponent(boolean b)
        Set whether this context is rendering in a table cell renderer or editor.
        Parameters:
        b - true if a table cell renderer or editor is being processed.

      • setInTreeComponent

        public void setInTreeComponent(boolean b)
        Set whether this context is rendering in a tree cell renderer or editor.
        Parameters:
        b - true if a tree cell renderer or editor is being processed.

      • setRendering

        public void setRendering(Collection<Component> rendering)
        Set the root of the render.
        Parameters:
        rendering - the components to render.
